page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF KINROSS AREA.
page.content: Kinross and Milnathort lie in an {agricultural lowland}beside Loch Leven south of the Ochil Hills, halfway between Perth and Dunfermline. At 120 -150mOD the area is low and sheltered anough enough for{intensive mixed {farming.}Lacking raw materials, other than sand&gravel and quarried rock (in the hills),{population}declined from 1851 to 1891, rose until 1921, dropped again into the 1960's and rose again only in the 1970's and onwards. Building of the M90 in the 1970's brought the area within{commuting distance of Edinburgh, so{new housing is spreading and the 4year secondary school has expanded to 6years since 1980.The principal{employer}is Todd& Duncan's cashmere mill, and main {attractions}are Loch Leven&its Castle, Kinross House and the Market/Auto Auction, all adjacent to the 12 km sq.
